abstracts.cdata!:
The Revenue Enhancement and Fiscal
            Management Technical Assistance Project will provide
            technical assistance in the form of consultant services,
            training, and equipment, including computer equipment for
            the adoption of modern information technology.  The Project
            will have three main components, focusing on the
            rehabilitation and modernization of: (a) the customs
            administration; (b) cadastre and land registration; and (c)
            domestic tax administration and Public Expenditure
            Management (PEM).  In addition, the Project will allocate
            money for a Project Implementation Team.  These expenditures
            included price and physical contingencies.  The activities
            in the domestic tax administration and the PEM component are
            currently being supported by a parallel activity with some
            initial grant financing from the United Nations Development
            Programme (UNDP).  The Revenue Enhancement and Fiscal
            Management Technical Assistance Project will finance the
            costs of consultants and some equipment for these activities
            to supplement the UNDP financing.
